channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.description:
Report X-2023120785

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CALL WAS MADE TO THE DMP CAGE ABOUT A POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER FOUND PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR WITH BOTTOM WET. WHEN RESPONDER OPENED PACKAGE, 1 4 -L GLASS BOTTEL WAS BROKEN. FOLLOWING ALL PROPER RESPONDR METHODS, PACKAGE WAS SECURED AND RETURNED TO THE DMP CAGE TO BE PROCESSED

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazardous materials staging area away from personnel and other packages. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was noted that one of the caps was loose on the plastic jug of isopropyl alcohol causing leakage. The only packaging was a corrugated liner. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials drum awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023120281
item.description:
Report X-2023120281

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-30
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazardous materials staging area away from personnel and other packages. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was noted that one of the glass bottles of methanol was missing and the plastic cap was broken on another bottle causing spillage. Slotted partitions and corrugated liners used for packaging. The glued bottom flaps of the box gave way causing the bottles to fall out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials drum awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023120267
item.description:
Report X-2023120267

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-19T18:11:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: RAEFORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UPON ARRIVAL TO THE TERMINAL, PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON TO THE VAN WHERE THE DRIVER FOUND IT HAVING LEAKED THROUGH THE OUTER PACKAGING CAUSING IT TO BE WET. AFTER GIVEN TO THE QA'S TO INSPECT, IT WAS FOUND TO BE 2 BOTTLES OF GRILL/OVEN CLEANER WHOSE PRODUCT HAD EATEN THROUGH THE SEAL UNDER THE LID AND LEAKED OUT OF THE NOT TIGHTENED CAP. DescribePack: SEAL FILM UNDER THE CAP HAD BEEN EATEN THROUGH BY THE CORROSIVE LIQUID. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: VAN DRIVER BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO THE QAS TO INSPECT THE DAMAGE. QAS DETERMINED THAT IT WAS A HAZMAT AND PLACED IT IN A DRUM AND PROCESSED THE DAMAGE

item.title: Report E-2023120217
item.description:
Report E-2023120217

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 20 liters of Ethyl Alcohol (UN1170) was released from one 20-liter plastic jug due to a forklift accident. The release impacted the concrete at dock door 61. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined staff onsite able to use the proper PPE onsite to collect (1) 10-gallon DF containing one 20-liter plastic jug of Ethyl Alcohol Undenatured and Oil Dri and it was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023120199

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: It was reported a damaged drum in Kernersville NC due to a forklift strike at a previous terminal, the 55Gal drum was punctured releasing a few drops (1 teaspoon) of ACRY GLOÂ®Urethane Charcoal (UN1263) material released onto the drum exterior. The terminal reviewed the SDS and it was decided they were comfortable handling the overstock and (1) 95G DF - OP Drum was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

DescribePack: Upon inspection package appeared to have 1 loose cap for one of the gallon jugs. Approximately 1 quart of corrosive liquid spilled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: put inside hazmat cage under fume hood

item.title: Report E-2023120097
item.description:
Report E-2023120097

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a one-cup spill of regulated UN2491 "Ethanolamine" that was released at Terminal NCH. (1) 55-gallon metal drum was damaged from a pinhole puncture that came from its pallet impacting the dock. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was decided it would be cleaned with PPE on hand. (1) 95-gallon poly drum overpack containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material, damaged metal drum, the remaining material, and the issued PPE was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023120120
item.description:
Report X-2023120120

  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to us from the IC belt manager because it was wet on the side and bottom of package. We inspected the box and found 2 of the 4 caps were loose and the contents spilled out and contaminated all 4 of the bottles. We made sure to place these in a lined hazmat tote and moved it to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: 2 loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We placed the package in a lined hazmat tote and moved this to the hazmat cage. We also made sure this didn't effect any other packages on the IC belt.

No other packages were affected by this leaking package. We put this package in a lined tote and placed in hazmat cage. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Repsonded quickly and isolated package to the hazmat cage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IC belt manager called QA on the radio to come and inspect a possible leaking hazmat. Upon inspection we found a loose cap on 1 of the 4 bottles of Condenser Coil Cleaner. Made sure that this hazmat didnt leak on any other boxes. We then put the box in a lined hazmat tote and isolated this in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Responded quickly and made sure to move the hazmat to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023120021
item.description:
Report X-2023120021

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager in QA brought the hazmat in a lined black tote and communicated was found under a belt. DescribePack: The front side of the box was wet from loose caps leaking gave off a bad smell. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Second that the box was discovered our QA manager immediately placed in a lined tote, still gave off a very bad smell. Placed the leaking contents under the hood vent in our hazmat cage for processing.
